data.title: Where Do The Portland Trail Blazers Play?
meta_keywords: Where do the Portland Trail Blazers Play
data.meta_description: Where Do The Portland Trail Blazers Play? Moda Center, formerly known as the Rose Garden, is the primary indoor sports arena in Portland, Oregon.

data.text:
Moda Center, formerly known as the Rose Garden, is the primary indoor sports arena in Portland, Oregon and is the home of the Portland Trail Blazers of the National Basketball Association (NBA). It is also used for ice hockey, rodeos, circuses, conventions, ice shows, concerts, and dramatic productions. The arena has a capacity of 19,393 spectators when configured for basketball and can accommodate a total of up to 20,796 patrons with standing room. It is equipped with state-of-the-art acoustics and other amenities. The arena features 70 Suites and 8 Skyboxes each with a seating capacity of 22 guests. Suites include amenities such as a wet bar, catering, a private restroom, multiple television monitors, and a sound system.

Although Portland only has one major professional sports team with the Portland Trail Blazers (NBA), the people of the Rose City have shown a level of commitment and passion for their sports team that is amongst some of the best around.

Besides the Trail Blazers, Portland is home to three other professional sports teams including the Portland Timbers (Major League Soccer), Portland Thunder (Arena Fooball League), the Portland Thorns (National Women's Soccer League) and the Hillsboro Hops (MiLB) the Arizona Diamondback's "A" affiliate.
